description: When the user feels shame, regret, or remorse for their past sins, mistakes, or shortcomings — and seeks forgiveness, renewal, and hope from Allah.

primary.text_en: Say, 'O My servants who have transgressed against themselves, do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins...'
primary.text_ar: قُلْ يَـٰعِبَادِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسْرَفُواْ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ لَا تَقْنَطُواْ مِن رَّحْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ...
primary.explanation: One of the most hope-filled verses — forgiveness is always open.

primary.text_en: Except those who repent, believe and do righteous work. For them Allah will replace their evil deeds with good...
primary.text_ar: إِلَّا مَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلًۭا صَـٰلِحًۭا فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يُبَدِّلُ ٱللَّهُ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِمْ حَسَنَـٰتٍۢ...
primary.explanation: Not only forgiveness — but transformation of sins into good deeds!

primary.text_en: ...And turn to Allah in repentance, all of you, O believers, that you might succeed.
primary.text_ar: وَتُوبُوٓاْ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ جَمِيعًا أَيُّهَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
primary.explanation: Success is tied to tawbah — no guilt can stop your return.

primary.text_en: O you who have believed, repent to Allah with sincere repentance...
primary.text_ar: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ تُوبُوٓا۟ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ تَوْبَةًۭ نَّصُوحًۭا...
primary.explanation: Sincerity is key — even if you’ve fallen repeatedly, return fully.

primary.text_en: Indeed, Allah loves those who are constantly repentant and those who purify themselves.
primary.text_ar: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلتَّوَّٰبِينَ وَيُحِبُّ ٱلْمُتَطَهِّرِينَ
primary.explanation: You are loved — not despite your guilt, but because you repent.

extra.text_en: And those who, when they commit an immorality or wrong themselves, remember Allah and seek forgiveness...
extra.text_ar: وَٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا فَعَلُوا۟ فَـٰحِشَةً أَوْ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ ذَكَرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ...
extra.explanation: It’s not about perfection — it’s about remembrance and return.

extra.text_en: And ask forgiveness of your Lord and then repent to Him...
extra.text_ar: وَأَنِ ٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ ثُمَّ تُوبُوٓا۟ إِلَيْهِ...
extra.explanation: The door is always open — knock again.

extra.text_en: Indeed, I am the Perpetual Forgiver of whoever repents and believes and does righteousness...
extra.text_ar: وَإِنِّى لَغَفَّارٌۭ لِّمَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا ثُمَّ ٱهْتَدَىٰ
extra.explanation: One of Allah’s Names is **Al-Ghaffar** — the constantly forgiving.

extra.text_en: And whoever does evil or wrongs himself but then seeks forgiveness of Allah will find Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
extra.text_ar: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ سُوٓءًا أَوْ يَظْلِمْ نَفْسَهُۥ ثُمَّ يَسْتَغْفِرِ ٱللَّهَ يَجِدِ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورًۭا رَّحِيمًۭا
extra.explanation: Guilt must lead to seeking — and what you find is Mercy.

extra.text_en: And it is He who accepts repentance from His servants and pardons misdeeds...
extra.text_ar: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى يَقْبَلُ ٱلتَّوْبَةَ عَنْ عِبَادِهِۦ وَيَعْفُوا۟ عَنِ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ...
extra.explanation: He *wants* to forgive — don’t let Shaytan tell you otherwise.

primary.text_en: The one who repents from sin is like one who never sinned.
primary.explanation: Tawbah doesn't just erase sin — it resets your record.

primary.text_en: Allah stretches out His hand at night to forgive the one who sinned during the day...
primary.explanation: Your guilt has a place to go — into Allah’s open hands.

primary.text_en: Every son of Adam sins, and the best of those who sin are those who repent.
primary.explanation: You’re not alone in guilt — you’re invited to be among the best.

primary.text_en: If you were not to sin, Allah would remove you and bring a people who would sin, and then seek forgiveness — and He would forgive them.
primary.explanation: Guilt is part of being human — but so is seeking mercy.

primary.text_en: A servant committed a sin and said: 'O Lord, I have sinned, forgive me.' Allah said, 'My servant has committed a sin and realized he has a Lord who forgives sins...'
primary.explanation: Acknowledging your sin is half the return — and Allah welcomes it.

extra.text_en: There is no sin that Allah will not forgive if one repents.
extra.explanation: Yes — *no* sin is too big for His Mercy.

extra.text_en: The gates of repentance are open until the soul reaches the throat.
extra.explanation: If you’re alive — it’s not too late.

extra.text_en: Verily Allah has written down the good deeds and the bad deeds...
extra.explanation: Even your intention to avoid sin brings reward.
Your guilt can actually draw you *closer* to Allah — not push you away.

extra.text_en: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'If you feel no shame, then do as you wish.'
extra.explanation: Guilt can act as a guard — a divine mercy in disguise.

duas.text_en: O Allah, You are my Lord, there is no deity except You. You created me and I am Your servant... I seek Your forgiveness and repent to You...
duas.text_ar: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ رَبِّي، لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ، خَلَقْتَنِي وَأَنَا عَبْدُكَ...
duas.explanation: This is the **Master of all forgiveness duas** — highly recommended for guilt.

duas.text_en: O Allah, forgive me all my sins — the minor and the major, the first and the last, those done in secret and in open.
duas.text_ar: اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي ذَنْبِي كُلَّهُ، دِقَّهُ وَجِلَّهُ، وَأَوَّلَهُ وَآخِرَهُ، وَعَلَانِيَتَهُ وَسِرَّهُ
duas.explanation: A comprehensive plea — nothing is left out.

reflection: Guilt means you care. It’s the soul’s alarm system saying: 'I want to return.' But know this — Allah is more pleased with your return than you could ever imagine. His Mercy was written before His Wrath. You are not your past. You are your repentance, your tears, your turning back. Don't run *from* Him. Run *to* Him.
